name: Andrii Vozniuk
title: PhD student in Computer Science
company: Coordination and Interaction Systems group (REACT). Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL)
bio: Andrii Vozniuk is a PhD student in Computer Science in the Coordination and Interaction Systems group (REACT) at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL). His research and software engineering activities focus on interaction systems and visual analytics in the domains of education and knowledge management. In the course his PhD studies he has developed a number of tools for analysis and visualization of students' activities in order to support awareness and reflection in blended inquiry learning sessions.

name: María Jesús Rodríguez-Triana
title: Post-doctoral researcher
company: Coordination and Interaction Systems group (REACT). Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL)
bio: María Jesús Rodríguez-Triana finished her Ph.D in Information and Communication Technologies at the University of Valladolid (Spain) in 2014. Currently, she is a post-doctoral researcher in the REACT Group at EPFL, Switzerland. Her research lines address classroom orchestration, learning design, and learning analytics with a special emphasis on teachers. Currently, she is investigating the obstacles that hinder adoption of learning analytics in authentic scenarios. She has organized workshops for teacher professional development and for scientists, on inquiry-based learning, learning analytics and ethical issues in TEL.

name: Denis Gillet
title: Head
company: Coordination and Interaction Systems group (REACT). Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL)
bio: Denis Gillet received his Ph.D. degree in Information Systems from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL) in 1995. He is currently Associate Professor at the EPFL School of Engineering, where he leads the REACT multi-disciplinary research group. Dr. Gillet is Associate Editor of the IEEE Transactions on Learning Technologies (TLT) and of the International Journal of Technology Enhanced Learning. His current research interests include Technologies Enhanced Learning (TEL), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Human Devices Interaction (HDI) and Optimal Coordination of Complex and Distributed Systems.

name: Luis P. Prieto
title: Marie Curie postdoctoral fellow
company: (CHILI) Lab. Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL)
bio: Luis P. Prieto is a Marie Curie postdoctoral fellow at the (CHILI) Lab in EPFL (Switzerland). He has done research on open architectures to communicate heterogeneous learning technologies, and currently he is modelling teacher orchestration load during collaborative work in technology-enhanced classrooms. He has organized multiple collaborative workshops for professional development of teachers, as well as for scientists in the context of research projects.

name: Roberto Martinez-Maldonado
title: Postdoctoral research associate
company: Connected Intelligence Centre (CIC). University of Technology, Sydney (UTS)
bio: Roberto Martinez-Maldonado is a postdoctoral research associate in the Connected Intelligence Centre (CIC) at the University of Technology, Sydney (UTS), Australia. He obtained his doctorate degree in 2014 from the University of Sydney, Australia. His areas of expertise include Human Computer Interaction, Learning Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Education.

name: Yannis Dimitriadis
title: Full Professor
company: GSIC/EMIC research group. University of Valladolid
bio: Yannis Dimitriadis is a Full Professor at the University of Valladolid, Spain, where he leads the GSIC/EMIC research group. His research interests include the technological support for orchestration of learning, from learning design to enactment and evaluation. He is an experienced workshop organizer, including several workshops in past editions of the CSCL and ICLS conferences, professional development workshops for teachers, and workshops in the context of research projects.

name: Angel Hernández-García
title: Professor
bio: Angel Hernández-García is M.Sc. in Telecommunication Engineering, Master SAP in Integrated Information Systems, and Ph.D. in Information Systems by the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid. Ángel is Assistant Professor at the UPM's School of Telecommunication Engineering. Currently, his research lines cover information systems’ acceptance and educational technologies, with special focus on learning analytics and educational data mining methods and applications. Ángel has been guest editor of, and published research papers in international journals. He is also chair of international conferences and is reviewer and member of the editorial board for leading journals in the fields of technology enhanced learning, information systems and business.
